intro: Dicerothamnus rhinocerotis, commonly known as the rhinoceros centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features a hairy, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Dicerothamnus rhinocerotis is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands.
